Edited November 14, 2015 by Venusgate

Grab the new release here: [url]https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/EVE-1.05-2[/url]
Still don't have clouds in the main menu, but it should help out those with issues with the initial release, as well as those who use the GUI.

Note, that progress will continue in the MASTER branch, not Overhaul.

Cloud rotation can now use multiple axis of rotation. This should be useful when making storms or trying to fake odd rotational angles of bodies (eg. Uranus). Still need to implement a mechanism to lock a rotational axis to the body rotation to gain full control over rotation.

Hey rbray, just been giving eve a go with the new Multiplanet support with scatterer. I came across an issue though it may be scatterer not eve. I get intermittent frame rate drops in scaled space around Venus. I have just one 4k cloud texture running on it and scatterer. This effect doubled or tripped when adding a second 1k layer, but on decending into pqs my frames went from about 50 to 15 and remained consistently low until exiting Venus' pqs. Again this was with just one cloud layer and no ground textures with eve. It may be something on my end or scatterer, but how fps dropped significantly after adding a layer leads me to think it may be a performance issue? Something that got changed under the hood?
Btw can/should I make some issues on git? :) Edited November 27, 2015 by pingopete

On 11/26/2015, 10:23:32, pingopete said:

Hey rbray, just been giving eve a go with the new Multiplanet support with scatterer. I came across an issue though it may be scatterer not eve. I get intermittent frame rate drops in scaled space around Venus. I have just one 4k cloud texture running on it and scatterer. This effect doubled or tripped when adding a second 1k layer, but on decending into pqs my frames went from about 50 to 15 and remained consistently low until exiting Venus' pqs. Again this was with just one cloud layer and no ground textures with eve. It may be something on my end or scatterer, but how fps dropped significantly after adding a layer leads me to think it may be a performance issue? Something that got changed under the hood?
Btw can/should I make some issues on git?

I'll look into it, but I'm not quite sure at the moment.
Where is the EVE Overhaul thread? I can't find it anymore. Also, is there a way to make Astronomer's Visual Pack: Edge of Oblivion use EVE Overhaul?

5 hours ago, Laythe Dweller said:

Where is the EVE Overhaul thread? I can't find it anymore. Also, is there a way to make Astronomer's Visual Pack: Edge of Oblivion use EVE Overhaul?

No such thing anymore. Overhaul has been merged into mainline.
Does it work with Edge of Oblivion?
Does it work with Edge of Oblivion?

I updated just now to get rid of the mun cities, and now my clouds lovely shadows have disappeared :'(

 

I pressed alt-0 to see the manager thing for the first time, i've never touched it before.

The "shadowmaterial" box is unticked, ticking it gets the shadows back but results in glitchy bits of terrain. I think that's the city lights that I can see. Also just noticed i might have scatterer turned up real high all of a sudden.

10 hours ago, Laythe Dweller said:

Does it work with Edge of Oblivion?

 

I have no idea... you'll have to try it out.

Been trying to add astronomers auroras into EVE but can't get'em to work.

I'm not doing any real work though, just trying different files to get it to work. I'm guessing it's just no longer compatible.

Astronomers stuff uses the same kind of code layout as old EVE, new EVE uses a totally new set of code so I guess it's just not working with each other.
